wikipedia_page.main: Evan Hayward (2 April 1876 – 30 January 1958) was a Liberal Party politician in England.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1918 United Kingdom general election

response: In the so-called Coupon Election of 1918, Major Evan Hayward was issued a Coalition 'coupon'. Hayward however repudiated the 'coupon' and stood as a Liberal and was elected. The following general election, in 1922, Sidney Webb, an early socialist and author of the Labour Party's then-new constitution, was returned.  Webb was easily re-elected in 1923 and 1924. Sidney Webb was raised to the peerage and his successor in the parliamentary constituency was Ramsay MacDonald, the leader of the Labour Party at the time. At the 1929 general election, MacDonald won and for the second time became Prime Minister over a minority Labour administration.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the January 1910 United Kingdom general election

response: a constituency which had been held by Liberal Unionists from 1886 to January 1910, when the sitting Liberal Unionist Frederick Lambton was defeated by the Liberal Party candidate Evan Hayward.
*Evan Hayward (1876–1968), English Liberal M.P. for South East Durham (1910–1918)
